context.title: XML Canonicalization (remove comments)
context.description: During canonicalization, the XML document is being normalized. This e.g. includes the removal of unnecessary whitespaces in tags, alphabetic ordering of attributes and UTF-8 as encoding. This variant will remove any XML comment and replace it with empty lines.

context.title: XML Canonicalization (maintain comments)
context.description: During canonicalization, the XML document is being normalized. This e.g. includes the removal of unnecessary whitespaces in tags, alphabetic ordering of attributes and UTF-8 as encoding. This variant keeps all XML comment.

context.title: XML Signature
context.description: Creates a new XML Signature for the selected XML document. You can sign the complete document or a fragment of it. Three signature variants - enveloping, enveloped and detached - are available.

context.title: XML Verification
context.description: During verification, all XML Signatures in the active XML document are verified. The result is displayed in the XML Signatures view.

context.title: XML Encryption
context.description: Creates a new XML Encryption for the selected XML document. You can encrypt the complete XML document or a fragment.

context.title: XML Decryption
context.description: Decrypts a chosen encryption in the active XML document and restores its plaintext.

Select a resource to sign (the complete document or a fragment of it), the signature type (enveloping, enveloped or detached) and a key option (create a new one or use an existing one). The Basic Security Profile option increases interoperability of Web Service Security.
Provide all required information for the key to use in the current signing process.
Provide all required information to insert a new key into a keystore. This key will be used in the current signing process and is stored in the selected keystore.

Provide all required information to create a new keystore together with a new key. This key will be used in the current signing process and is stored in the current project folder as [Keystore Name].jks.

Select a canonicalization and a transformation algorithm, a message digest and a signature algorithm. The signature properties are optional. A new property can be added by clicking on the + button. The signature id is optional but makes it much easier to identify the signature. The characters <, >, &, ", ' and blanks are not allowed as id (signature id and signature property id), the maximum length is 20 characters. Selecting the Start Encryption Wizard afterwards checkbox opens the Encryption Wizard after a successful digital signature operation.

context.title: Resource and Encryption Type
context.description: Select the resource to encrypt (the complete document or a fragment of it), the encryption type (enveloping or detached) and a key option (use an existing one, insert a new key in a keystore, create a new keystore and a new key). The Basic Security Profile option increases interoperability of Web Service Security.

context.title: Use a key from an existing keystore
context.description: Use an existing key in the active encryption process. Provide all required information for this key and continue to the last wizard page.

topic.label: Use a key from an existing keystore

context.title: Insert a new key in an existing keystore
context.description: Create a new key for the active encryption process. Provide all required information and insert the new key into an existing keystore and continue to the last wizard page.

topic.label: Insert a new key in an existing keystore

context.title: Create a new key and a new keystore
context.description:
Create a new keystore and insert a new key to use in the active encryption process. Provide all required information and continue to the last wizard page.
The keystore will be stored in the current (project) folder as [Keystore Name].jks.

topic.label: Create a new key and a new keystore

context.title: Algorithms and Encryption Properties
context.description: Select the encryption algorithms and decide whether you want to completely encrypt the XML data or keep the root element as plain text. The encryption id is optional but makes it much easier to identify the encryption. The characters <, >, &, ", ' and blanks are not allowed as id, the maximum length is 20 characters. Selecting the Start Digital Signature Wizard afterwards checkbox opens the XML Signature Wizard after a successful encryption operation.
This dialog displays all XML elements in the active XML document as unique XPath expressions. You can select exactly one element you want to use in the current signing or encrypting process.

context.title: Encryption Type and ID
context.description: If you didn't enter an encryption id during the encryption process you can only select to decrypt the first encrypted data found in the selected document. Otherwise select the desired encryption id. Select the encryption type (enveloping or detached). Selecting detached starts to search the selected encryption (identified by the id) for the reference to the detached file. This URI information is displayed below. Click Next to continue to the next wizard page.

context.title: Encryption Keystore and Key
context.description: Select the Keystore used for encrypting this document (-fragment) and enter the password for the store. Provide the key name and enter the corresponding password. Click Next to start the decryption process.
This preference page allows you to configure the general preferences of the XML Security Tools including Canonicalization settings.
This preference page allows you to configure the preferences for the Quick Signature and Quick Verification functionality of the XML Security Tools.
This preference page allows you to configure the preferences for the Quick Encryption and Quick Decryption functionality of the XML Security Tools.

This view displays all XML Signatures (valid, invalid and unkown) found in the selected XML document. Click Refresh for a new scan of the active XML document. Select one verification result and click Properties for detailed information about the selected XML Signature.
